events.title: Former South Korean President Yoon sentenced to life for imposing martial law
events.summary: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison Thursday for imposing martial law to suppress the opposition in December 2024.

events.title: Trump administration balances Ukraine talks and Russia deal prospects
events.summary: The U.S. concluded another round of talks to end the war in Ukraine as the White House pressured Ukraine while exploring potential business opportunities with Russia amid a reported economic proposal.

events.title: Russia expert discusses the role of investments in pursuit of peace
events.summary: Ukraine's president says Russia offered the U.S. a $13 trillion economic proposal. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to historian Sergey Radchenko about the role of investment in the pursuit of peace.

events.title: Iran and the U.S. lean into gunboat diplomacy as nuclear talks hang in balance
events.summary: Iran and the United States leaned into gunboat diplomacy Thursday, with Tehran holding drills with Russia and the Americans bringing another aircraft carrier closer to the Mideast.

events.title: Former South Korean President Yoon receives life sentence for imposing martial law
events.summary: Former President Yoon Suk Yeol was sentenced to life in prison for his brief imposition of martial law in December 2024.

events.title: José María Balcázar becomes Peru's eighth president in a decade
events.summary: José María Balcázar has become Peru's new interim president, replacing another interim leader who was removed over corruption allegations just four months into his term.

events.title: Trump gathers members of Board of Peace for first meeting, with some U.S. allies wary
events.summary: President Donald Trump will gather Thursday with representatives from more than two dozen countries that have joined his Board of Peace, for a meeting that will focus on the reconstruction of Gaza.

events.title: With a win over Sweden, the U.S. men's hockey team will play for an Olympic medal
events.summary: A thrilling overtime goal by defenseman Quinn Hughes puts Team USA through to a semifinal game against Slovakia. On the other side of the bracket, Canada had its own close call, but moves on to face Finland.

events.title: Australia bans a citizen with alleged IS links from returning from Syria
events.summary: The Australian is among a group of 34 women and children who had planned to fly from Damascus to Australia on Monday but were turned back by Syrian authorities to the Roj detention camp due to procedural problems.

events.title: Russia's hybrid warfare rattles Poland and NATO
events.summary: Russia is stepping up covert attacks across Europe — rail sabotage, drones, cyberstrikes — testing NATO. Polish officials warn "disposable agents" are sowing fear and weakening support for Ukraine.

events.title: Will Franco‑German differences sink €100bn fighter jet plan?
events.summary: Reports suggest the long-planned Franco-German FCAS air defense project is near collapse. In an exclusive interview with DW, Airbus Defence CEO Michael Schoellhorn says it needs to be restructured to survive.

events.title: US-Iran news: Trump dials up pressure amid diplomatic talks
events.summary: The White House said there are many "reasons and arguments that one could make for a strike against Iran" but that diplomacy is always the first option. It comes as the US rapidly builds up a military presence near Iran.

events.title: Palestinian journalists tortured in Israeli prisons — report
events.summary: A report by the Committee to Protect Journalists, a US-based NGO, lists accounts of media professionals held by Israel since October 7, 2023. Israel has repeatedly denied reports of mistreatment of prisoners.

events.title: Nationality at the Olympics: Does it matter?
events.summary: When athletes born in one place compete for another, a conversation around nationality and identity soon follows. But what does it mean?

events.title: South Korean court hands life sentence to ex-president Yoon
events.summary: A Seoul court has ruled that South Korea's former president, Yoon Suk Yeol, led an insurrection during his December 2024 martial law declaration. He was sentenced to life in prison.

events.title: North Korea unveils nuclear-capable rocket launchers
events.summary: Kim Jong Un said the new weapons system was a gift for the Ninth Congress of the ruling Workers' Party — a landmark meeting set to begin soon.

events.title: UN Security Council blasts Israel's West Bank plans
events.summary: The UN Security Council discussed the situation in the Palestinian Territories on the eve of US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace meeting on Gaza ceasefire.

events.title: Trump flips position on UK's Chagos Islands deal approval
events.summary: After initially saying he supported the deal, the US president called it a "big mistake." London stood by the agreement, saying it was the "only way" to guarantee a strategic joint military base with the US.

events.title: Mark Zuckerberg testifies in social media addiction trial
events.summary: Google and Mark Zuckerberg's Meta have been accused of deliberately making platforms addictive to children and harming their mental health.

events.title: US: Eight skiers dead after avalanche in California
events.summary: The eight skiers were part of a three-day trek in Sierra Nevada. One more person is still missing, and the efforts are focusing on recovery rather than rescue. Six other members of the group were found alive earlier.

events.title: US: Trump's EPA sued by environmentalist, health groups
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has revoked a 2009 EPA declaration that determined carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases as a threat to public health and welfare. Several groups are now challenging this decision in court.

events.title: Europe looks to Australia's social media ban for kids
events.summary: Germany has joined the growing list of EU nations that are considering banning children from social media. Australia has banned youths from social media since December — and its example has lessons for EU governments.

events.title: United States and Iran at impasse after Geneva nuclear talks
events.summary: The latest round of negotiations on Iran's nuclear program has ended without a breakthrough — and the threat of US military action looms large. The ball seems to be back in Iran's court.

events.title: State elections could spell doom for Germany's oldest party
events.summary: The Social Democrats were once a "big tent" party, with the support of almost half of Germany's electorate. Now, the SPD is fighting for relevance. This year, five state elections could spell trouble for the party.

events.title: Deutsche Bahn says cyberattack hit ticket and info systems
events.summary: Germany's national rail operator says it was hit with a cyberattack on its systems that disrupted ticketing and timetable information.

events.title: Greenland: Denmark's King Frederik X visits Nuuk
events.summary: King Frederik is visiting the partly autonomous Danish territory of Greenland, following the tensions prompted by US President Donald Trump last month.

events.title: North Korean POWs stuck in Ukraine as Seoul hesitates
events.summary: Two North Korean soldiers in Ukraine have asked to move to South Korea rather than facing dire consequences for letting themselves be captured in the North. The regime might choose to punish their families instead.

events.title: South Africa mulls using military to combat organized crime
events.summary: President Cyril Ramaphosa's announced plan to deploy the military to fight crime has elicited mixed reactions from South Africans. Analysts say public confidence can only be restored through a policing overhaul.

events.title: India AI summit: Brazil's Lula lands, US giants tout plans
events.summary: Brazil's President Lula da Silva has arrived in New Delhi, while Google and Nvidia hail Indian expansion plans. Meanwhile, China felt the sting of intellectual property appropriation for once in a robot dog scandal.

events.title: Why a German shipping deal alarms Israel's government
events.summary: Hapag-Lloyd's deal to buy a major Israeli shipping company is colliding with national-security red lines. Critics say the purchase could expose critical infrastructure at a volatile moment in the Middle East.

events.title: Berlinale: Women from Iran, Afghanistan debut bold films
events.summary: These two female filmmakers express the injustice they've experienced in their home countries in contrasting genres: a romantic comedy — and a nightmarish drama.

events.title: From boom to burden: How overtourism hit European cities
events.summary: Many destinations are groaning under the strain of vacationers. So what turns certain places into tourist magnets? It isn't just the famous landmarks.

events.title: For a healthy break, don't check your ex's social media
events.summary: It feels harmless to peek at an ex’s posts on social media. But studies show that repeated checking can intensify heartbreak, prolong longing and slow emotional recovery.

events.title: Vatican declines participation in Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: The Vatican has said it will not take part in the "Board of Peace" established by US President Donald Trump. It said the UN was the right body to manage global crises.

events.title: ECB's Christine Lagarde planning early exit — report
events.summary: Christine Lagarde, the head of Europe's most important financial institution, plans to leave her job before her eight-year term ends in October 2027, the Financial Times reported.

events.title: China shock: Will Merz take on Germany's top rival?
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz is scrambling to defend German industry from the economic upheaval caused by intense rivalry from China. Momentum is building to impose new trade barriers to stop unfair trade practices.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Geneva peace talks end abruptly
events.summary: A second day of talks between Ukraine and Russia ended after just two hours on Wednesday. The Ukrainian side said talks were "difficult" while the chief Russian negotiator said further talks would follow. DW has more.

events.title: Bayer agrees to pay billions to settle Roundup lawsuits
events.summary: German chemical giant Bayer and cancer patient attorneys have agreed to a proposed $7.25 billion settlement over lawsuits claiming that glyphosate in its Roundup weedkiller causes cancer.

events.title: France arrests nine in right-wing activist's death
events.summary: Far-right activist Quentin Deranque was killed last week, seemingly in a clash with the far left.

events.title: Banana farm pesticides back in focus after sterility ruling
events.summary: A French court has rejected a compensation claim against US multinationals by Nicaraguan farm workers poisoned by the pesticide Nemagon. Farmers worldwide still rely on noxious chemicals, often exported from the EU.

events.title: Javier Bardem, Tilda Swinton among signatories denouncing Berlinale's Gaza 'silence'
events.summary: More than 80 current and former participants in Germany's Berlinale film festival signed an open letter accusing it of silence over Gaza. The festival's director previously defended filmmakers who chose not to comment.

events.title: Shein faces EU investigation over products, design features
events.summary: EU regulators are investigating Shein on suspicion that it has not done enough to limit the sale of illegal products and to protect consumers from allegedly addictive design features on the platform.

events.title: Czech Republic: Government attacks public television and radio
events.summary: Prime Minister Andrej Babis' new right-wing populist government wants to bring the Czech public broadcaster under its control. One of its reforms is to abolish licensing fees.

events.title: Russian and Belarussian flags to return at 2026 Paralympics
events.summary: The International Paralympic Committee has granted six wildcard spots to Russia and four to Belarus for the upcoming Winter Games. The athletes will not be required to participate under a neutral flag.

events.title: Bulgaria: How six deaths fueled distrust in the authorities
events.summary: A case of suspected murder-suicide involving six victims has sparked a wave of conspiracy theories and speculation in Bulgaria, reflecting endemic distrust in state institutions and growing political tension.

events.title: Italy enjoy historic Winter Games: Is home advantage real?
events.summary: Italy's athletes have won a record 25 medals at the 2026 Winter Olympics. How much of their success is because they are competing on home snow?

events.title: Nigeria investigates Temu for possible data privacy breaches
events.summary: Nigeria's data watchdog has opened an investigation into Chinese online retail discounter Temu, on suspicion of violations of data law. The company is facing mounting scrutiny amid its global expansion.

events.title: Book by mass rape survivor Gisele Pelicot tells her story
events.summary: She refuses to be a victim: Having survived years of assaults orchestrated by her husband while she was drugged unconscious, Pelicot chronicles in "A Hymn to Life" her path back to life.

events.title: Lower Saxony: AfD state chapter designated extremist group
events.summary: The state intelligence agency for Lower Saxony has upgraded the state chapter of Alternative for Germany (AfD) party to a "surveillance object of considerable import." This gives investigators more monitoring options.

events.title: Germany's governing CDU eyes reforms at party conference
events.summary: Germany is grappling with social reforms and so are the Christian Democrats (CDU). Their party conference will focus on welfare policy and state elections, as former Chancellor Angela Merkel makes a long-awaited return.

events.title: Why is the Strait of Hormuz off Iran so crucial?
events.summary: The Strait of Hormuz is considered the world's most critical chokepoint for the oil trade. Iran has repeatedly threatened to block the waterway and now is partially closing it for military drills.

events.title: Spain to investigate big tech over AI child abuse imagery
events.summary: Spain is set to investigate X, Meta and TikTok for allegedly spreading AI-generated child abuse material. The move comes as European nations tighten controls to regulate social media platforms.

events.title: Germany inflation rises 2.1% at start of 2026
events.summary: Increases in food and fuel prices were the main drivers of inflation in Germany, new statistics confirmed.

events.title: Spain: Five young people killed in Catalonia building fire
events.summary: At least five young people were killed in a fire that broke out a five-story apartment block in Spain's northeastern Catalonia region.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Peace talks in Geneva 'very tense'
events.summary: Ukrainian and Russian officials are meeting in Geneva for another round of talks aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. The talks come just days before the 4-year anniversary of Russia's invasion of its neighbor.

events.title: France's Macron in India to boost Rafale deal talks, AI ties
events.summary: Emmanuel Macron is in India at a time when the country is looking to upgrade its air force, with the Indian government giving preliminary approval to buy more than 100 additional Rafale jets last week.

events.title: Ukraine: In Kyiv, exhausted emergency repair crews work around the clock
events.summary: No electricity, no heating, no water: that's the reality of life in Kyiv. The bitter cold makes the destruction of war even harder to bear. DW spoke to the workers constantly on call to repair the housing infrastructure.

events.title: Ireland launches data protection probe into Grok's deepfakes
events.summary: This latest investigation, on behalf of the EU, will look into whether X violated the bloc's data protection rules. Violations can lead to hefty fines.

events.title: The frog poison that killed Alexei Navalny likely lab-made
events.summary: A rare frog poison has been named as the cause of Russian democracy fighter Alexei Navalny's 2024 death. But it's unlikely to have come from a frog.

events.title: 'Apocalypse Now' actor Robert Duvall dies aged 95
events.summary: Robert Duvall won an Oscar for "Tender Mercies" and earned nominations for classics including "The Godfather," "Apocalypse Now," and "The Great Santini."

events.title: Austria files terror charges in alleged Taylor Swift concert plot
events.summary: Prosecutors in Austria have filed terrorism charges against a 21-year-old who was allegedly plotting to attack a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna in 2024.

events.title: Will Europe move to boost diplomacy with Russia?
events.summary: Debate is growing in Brussels about appointing an EU special envoy to deal with Russia. However, internal splits might prevent the bloc from playing a decisive role.

events.title: Ukraine: Former energy minister accused of money laundering
events.summary: Ukrainian anti-corruption bodies have accused the former energy minister of money laundering. Prosecutors allege that his family received millions of dollars in foreign accounts.

events.title: Obama clarifies his 'they're real' podcast comment on aliens
events.summary: Barack Obama caused an online stir by telling a podcaster aliens were "real," albeit stressing he had not seen any as US president. He's since clarified that he believes they exist, rather than having special knowledge.

events.title: Rubio praises Orban and Hungary ahead of crunch election
events.summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has backed Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban's leadership during a visit to Budapest. Nationalist leader Orban faces a strong opposition challenge ahead of elections in April.

events.title: How Epstein got so rich
events.summary: How did the well-connected financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein amass such great wealth?

events.title: France: Macron's pro-business agenda hit by budget chaos
events.summary: France's 2026 budget finally passed the country's parliament, putting an end to months of deadlock. But for some, the bill marks the end of President Macron's pro-business policies.

events.title: 2026 Year of the Horse: Humans and horses go way back
events.summary: Highly valued in diverse cultures, the horse gallops to pole position in the Chinese zodiac. Famous horse babies include Nelson Mandela and Jackie Chan.

events.title: Why we're becoming disconnected from nature
events.summary: Scientists report a rise in nature anxiety, or biophobia, warning that humans are losing touch with the natural world. Here's how to reconnect.

events.title: Germany news: Right-wing violence rises in 2025
events.summary: Germany has recorded more cases of violent right-wing crime in 2025 than the previous year. The Berlin Film Festival has defended itself amid a controversy on its stance toward politics.

events.title: As the telephone turns 150, are we hanging up on phone calls?
events.summary: Today, 150 years after the invention of the telephone, it has never been easier to call someone. But in some ways, and for some people, picking up the phone is still a very hard thing to do.

events.title: AI-fueled chip shortage drives up smartphone prices
events.summary: The era of cheap data storage is ending. Artificial intelligence is pushing chip prices higher and exacerbating supply shortages. Anyone buying a new smartphone in 2026 should brace for higher prices.

events.title: Does this chemical really make you fall in love?
events.summary: For years, oxytocin was thought of as the love drug: enhancing trust and emotional connection. But the truth is more complex.

events.title: Germany's big builds: Why delays and cost overruns are so common
events.summary: Major construction projects are rarely finished on time and usually cost much more than expected. What ever happened to German efficiency?

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.summary: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: Vladislav Heraskevych's Olympic helmet appeal dismissed
events.summary: The skeleton racer failed in his bid to compete at the Winter Games. Vladislav Heraskevych lost an appeal to the CAS after the IOC banned him from competing with a helmet featuring the names of killed Ukrainian athletes.

events.title: Germany: Security alert halts flights at Cologne/Bonn airport
events.summary: Cologne/Bonn Airport temporarily suspended outgoing passenger processing after police cleared the security area as a precaution. The alert, which has been lifted, followed the introduction of new screening technology.

events.title: Trump drops key US climate rule, swaps health for cheap cars
events.summary: The US has revoked what's known as the endangerment finding, a scientific finding central to US climate actions, to boost cheaper, gas-powered cars. Experts say the shift comes at a fragile point for the warming planet.

events.title: Germany braces for more strikes in 2026
events.summary: This year has already seen considerable industrial action and labor disputes in Germany. More strikes are expected in the aviation, train travel and chemicals industries.

events.title: Should the Berlinale film festival 'stay out of politics’?
events.summary: Asked if the Berlin International Film Festival should take a stand on Gaza, jury president Wim Wenders said it must "stay out of politics." Not everyone agrees.

events.title: France, Germany signal unity at EU's Belgium castle retreat
events.summary: Emmanuel Macron and Friedrich Merz greeted the press together on arrival at the Alden Biesen Castle, with Macron saying they shared a "sense of urgency" on economic reform. But the two may clash on the way forward.

events.title: Germany's new plans to tackle spiralling rents
events.summary: Tenants in big cities like Berlin are being exploited by the use of legal loopholes to circumvent rent control laws. The government is now planning to introduce new rules for furnished and short-term rentals.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is embarking on his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: First German politician enters Gaza since October 7 attack
events.summary: The speaker of the Bundestag, Julia Klöckner, entered as far as the so-called "Yellow Line" of predominantly Israeli control in Gaza. She held no talks with Palestinians, prompting some criticism at home.

events.title: 'Threat to world peace': How Germans see the US now
events.summary: Back in 2016, German trust in the United States was at all-time high. Today the situation could not be more different. This is mostly due to US President Donald Trump and his unpredictable policies.

events.title: Merkel calls speculation about German presidency bid 'absurd'
events.summary: The office of former Chancellor Angela Merkel has dismissed reports that she could be in the running to become Germany's next president. Political parties are weighing who might replace President Steinmeier next year.

events.title: Germany news: Carnival security threat level remains high
events.summary: Police in Germany’s Carnival hotspots say they are on high alert, but point out there are no concrete security threats to this year’s celebrations. Meanwhile, carmaker Mercedes-Benz has seen profits halve. DW has more.

events.title: TikTok and beats: Cologne's famed Carnival has a new image
events.summary: Cologne's Carnival celebration has a new sound. Young music, viral hits and new costume trends are re-shaping the event. Carnival is more than just a tradition — it has secured itself a place in pop culture as well.

events.title: Germany's far-right AfD party accused of nepotism
events.summary: Turmoil has engulfed the far-right Alternative for Germany party (AfD). Allegations of nepotism and weak leadership are circulating, and influential officials warn the party is jeopardizing its election prospects.

events.title: Epstein files implicate Germany's Deutsche Bank
events.summary: The latest release of Epstein files show the late financier and convicted sex offender had up to 40 accounts with Deutsche Bank.

events.title: Ukraine athlete Heraskevych: 'My Olympic moment was stolen'
events.summary: Ukrainian skeleton athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych was disqualified from the Winter Games over his 'helmet of remembrance.' He has now appealed his case to the Court of Administation for Sport.

events.title: Olympics: Ukrainian athlete banned over 'political' helmet
events.summary: The IOC has disqualified Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych for wearing a helmet that features images of Ukrainian athletes killed during Russia's war on Ukraine.

events.title: Germany: Lufthansa strike grounds hundreds of flights
events.summary: Pilots and flight attendants at Germany's flag carrier are staging an all-day walkout. Lufthansa has called the action "a completely unnecessary" escalation.

events.title: Germany's Deutsche Bahn halts humorous publicity campaign
events.summary: German Rail was once famed for its punctuality. But chronic delays, frequent cancellations, poor in-train services and rising ticket prices have dogged its reputation. And a humorous PR campaign has not helped.

events.title: Germany: Tesla charges trade union member in IG Metall fight
events.summary: Tesla's German factory in Grünheide is pressing charges against an external trade union member. The company said he was caught recording a confidential meeting without permission; the IG Metall union called this a lie.

events.title: Greenland's Olympic siblings keen to help protect homeland
events.summary: Sondre and Ukaleq Slettemark usually make up Greenland's biathlon team, despite a lack of facilities. But they are competing for Denmark at the Winter Olympics and, unlike Donald Trump, they want it to stay that way.

events.title: Berlinale film festival blends politics, pop culture
events.summary: An Afghan feature opens the Berlin International Film Festival, while stars including Pamela Anderson, Ethan Hawke and John Turturro are expected on the red carpet.

events.title: Berlinale 2026 honors Michelle Yeoh, icon of cinema
events.summary: Recognized with the Honorary Golden Bear in Berlin, the Malaysian actor became the first Asian woman to receive an Oscar, in 2023 for her role in "Everything Everywhere All at Once."

events.title: Olympics T-shirt marking 1936 Berlin Games raises eyebrows
events.summary: T-shirts on the Olympics online store commemorating past venues include one for the 1936 Games in Berlin. Nazi Germany hosted both the Winter and Summer Olympics that year, as it was starting to ramp up its repression.

events.title: Samer Tawk: From intensive care to Winter Olympic return
events.summary: In 2018, Samer Tawk became the first athlete to represent Lebanon in cross-country skiing at the Winter Olympics. A year later, he was lying in a hospital bed wondering if he would ever walk again.

events.title: German government pushes Syrians to return to their homeland
events.summary: Nearly 6,000 Syrians in Germany applied for voluntary return to Syria in 2025. But with security concerns lingering and reconstruction slow, Syria remains too unstable for most refugees to consider going back.

events.title: Lufthansa pilots, crew to strike on Thursday
events.summary: Lufthansa passengers should expect disruption and possible cancellations. A pilots' trade union has called a 24-hour strike amid a dispute over pension payments.

events.title: The German Olympic ski jump winner with a fear of heights
events.summary: German ski jumper Philipp Raimund hasn't won a single World Cup event. That's just part of what makes his Olympic gold medal performance so incredible.

events.title: Italy: Rai sports staff to strike over Olympic opening farce
events.summary: RaiSport's director gave himself the announcer's job for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony and then proceeded to botch it. Staff have announced a strike in protest to begin once the Games are finished.

events.title: IOC bars Ukrainian skeleton racer from wearing memorial helmet at Olympics
events.summary: Ukraine's bid to let skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych use a helmet honoring athletes killed in the war with Russia has been rejected by the International Olympic Committee.

events.title: Corruption watchdog reports increase in global graft
events.summary: Once seen as anti-graft strongholds, the US, UK, Canada and Sweden are slipping into decline due to a lack of political leadership, Transparency International's Corruption Perception Index has revealed.

events.title: Germany's gas reserves face crucial energy supply test
events.summary: The country's stockpiles have dropped to about 30% amid a spell of severe cold. Will supplies hold up?

events.title: Nature: the economy's secret lifeline?
events.summary: New global research exposes the business–nature link we can’t afford to ignore — plus the playbook for fixing it.

events.title: Super Bowl 2026: Seattle Seahawks beat New England Patriots
events.summary: The Seattle Seahawks have defeated the New England Patriots in the NFL's showpiece event, with Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny making history by performing the halftime show in Spanish.

events.title: Fake Berlin Wall fragments on sale as souvenirs?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they the real deal?

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: How the Epstein-Barr virus triggers MS in some people
events.summary: Multiple sclerosis is also caused by a virus carried by almost all humans. A new study provides an explanation as to why only certain people develop the disease. This also opens up the possibility of a treatment.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony — as it happened
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW followed the official opening to the 25th edition of the games live in Milan.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: Winter Olympics begin quietly with curling
events.summary: The mixed doubles curling event kicked off the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics two days before the official opening of the Games.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.summary: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions — and what about security and doping?

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Cuba: Fuel crisis caused by US oil blockade impacts daily life
events.summary: Daily life for #Cuba's residents has become increasingly difficult in recent weeks, with shrinking #fuel supplies impacting the country's transportation network, #power supply and #garbage disposal systems.

events.title: US buildup of warships and fighter jets sets stage for potential war with Iran
events.summary: The US has deployed 13 warships and a large fleet of aircraft to the Middle East, with a second aircraft carrier also en route, setting the stage for a potential military confrontation with Iran less than a year after President Donald Trump ordered strikes on the country's nuclear facilities.

events.title: UK condemns 'appalling' 10-year sentence for British couple held in Iran
events.summary: A British couple detained in Iran since January 2025 have been sentenced to 10 years in jail for espionage, their family announced on Thursday. The UK government has condemned the prison terms for Lindsay and Craig Foreman as "completely appalling and totally unjustifiable".

events.title: Champions League: Gordon scores four goals as Newcastle crush Qarabag
events.summary: Anthony Gordon scored four goals in the first half as dominant Newcastle ran riot in the first leg of the Champions League last 16 play-off tie against Qarabag in Azerbaijan (6-1).

events.title: 🔴 South Korean court sentences ex-president Yoon to life in prison for 2024 insurrection
Europe will be a 'safe space' for AI innovation, Macron tells India summit
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron told the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi that the EU would continue to "shape the rules of the game" regarding artificial intelligence in concert with allies, describing Europe as a "safe space" for innovation and investment that would also protect children from digital abuse.

events.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta's policies on children at landmark social media trial
events.summary: Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg defended the company’s policies on children and platform design during a landmark US trial examining whether social media firms knowingly harmed young users, as internal documents and testimony highlighted tensions between safety claims and growth strategies.

events.title: Live: Trump launches 'Board of Peace' with global ambitions beyond Gaza
events.summary: US President Donald Trump's allies will gather in Washington on Thursday to inaugurate the “Board of Peace”, a new body aimed at consolidating progress in Gaza while signalling broader ambitions to reshape international conflict management. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jon-Un unveils nuclear-capable rocket system
events.summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has unveiled a large array of nuclear-capable rocket launchers ahead of a rare congress of the ruling Workers’ Party, signalling the next stage of the country’s nuclear weapons programme.

events.title: Top US commander makes surprise visit to Venezuela after Maduro’s capture
events.summary: The top US military commander for Latin America, General Francis Donovan, and senior Pentagon official Joseph Humire made an unannounced visit to Venezuela on Wednesday for security talks with interim authorities in Caracas. This marks the first US military delegation trip to Venezuela since the capture of the country's ousted leader Nicolas Maduro last month.

events.title: South Korea court sentences ex-president Yoon to life in prison for 2024 insurrection
events.summary: A South Korean court on Thursday found ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol guilty of leading an insurrection for his short-lived attempt to impose martial law in December 2024, sentencing the former leader to life imprisonment.

events.title: Carnival parade honouring Lula finishes last in samba competition amid backlash
events.summary: A Rio Carnival parade paying tribute to President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has been relegated after finishing last in the city’s top samba school competition, as critics denounced elements of the performance that mocked conservatives and traditional family values.

events.title: Ukraine's officials to boycott Paralympics over Russian flag decision
events.summary: Ukrainian officials will boycott the Paralympic Winter Games, Kyiv said on Wednesday, after the International Paralympic Committee allowed Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flag. The EU's sports commissioner Glenn Micallef said he would also skip the opening ceremony. FRANCE 24's Camille Corcoran reports.

events.title: How the killing of a French far-right activist sparked an online manhunt
events.summary: The killing of 23-year-old French nationalist Quentin Deranque, on the sidelines of a protest in Lyon, has heightened tensions between far-right and far-left groups ahead of next month's municipal elections. Before any arrests were made, online users claimed to have identified five suspects, leading to the circulation of their personal details. But the internet sleuths got at least one case wrong: a woman identified as Blandine B., who was not even in France on the day of the killing.

events.title: Court to deliver verdict in ousted South Korean president Yoon’s insurrection trial
events.summary: South Korea's disgraced former president Yoon Suk Yeol could be banished to death row on February 19 when he fronts court over his disastrous bid to impose martial law. Seoul's Central District Court will rule on insurrection charges against the 65-year-old, delivering a verdict that will be broadcast live across the nation. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Youngmi Kim, Senior Lecturer at the department of Asian Studies at the University of Edinburgh.

events.title: Gabon suspends access to social media amid teachers' strike
events.summary: In tonight's edition, Gabon suspends major social media platforms, including Facebook and TikTok, amid an anti-government teachers’ strike. Also, Brent Bozell, Trump’s controversial pick for US ambassador, arrives in South Africa. And we head to the Sambadrome, where Rio Carnival comes to a dazzling close, celebrating African roots in a pulsating festival of culture and joy.

events.title: 'If we can get a Coca-Cola to the most remote parts of the world, we can get cooking gas, as well'
events.summary: In Africa clean cooking is an issue of major concern, and with a billion people relying on wood and charcoal to cook their food each day there is a disproportionate number of deaths due to fine particle air pollution. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Andy Herscowitz, CEO of Mission 300 Accelerator, about the group's aim to expand access to modern and cleaner cooking technologies across Africa. https://www.rockefellerfoundation.org/news/rockefeller-foundation-global-energy-alliance-clean-cooking-alliance-energy-corps-scale-modern-cooking-technologies-in-africa/

events.title: Sudanese people face 'generations of trauma', head of UN OCHA tells France 24
events.summary: Discussing the unfolding humanitarian catastrophe in war-torn Sudan, Tom Fletcher, UN Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs, explains that the Sudanese people face "generations of trauma" and "they're crying out for peace", stressing that "the world isn't responding with the generosity and solidarity that we need".

events.title: How Israel is spraying herbicides on Syrian crops
events.summary: Israeli planes sprayed chemicals on farmland in Quneitra, Syria in late January and early February, 2026. Farmers say that their crops yellowed and died in just a few days and that they lost dozens of hectares of farmland. There have been similar reports of the Israeli Army spraying fields in southern Lebanon and of Israeli settlers doing the same in the West Bank.

events.title: Eight of nine missing skiers found dead in California avalanche
events.summary: Eight skiers have died after an avalanche tore through the slopes of California's Sierra Nevada mountains, authorities said Wednesday, as rescuers continued searching for one other missing person from the group.

events.title: White House tells Iran to strike deal as Trump renews military threat
events.summary: The White House warned Iran it would be “wise” to reach a deal with the United States, as President Donald Trump again raised the prospect of military action amid renewed, Oman-mediated talks. The remarks come as tensions remain high following recent protests and a fragile diplomatic push between Tehran and Washington.

events.title: Humanitarian situation in Ukraine 'the worst it's ever been', IFRC says
events.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Scott Craig, Senior Communications Officer at the IFRC, explains that the humanitarian situation in Ukraine 'it's the worst it's ever been' and organisations working on the ground in Ukraine face a funding challenge as 'international support for humanitarian funding in Ukraine is dwindling'.

events.title: Pressure mounts on France's far-left party after killing of far-right activist
events.summary: Pressure is mounting on France's far left political party France Unbowed, in the wake of the brutal killing of a far right student activist last week. 11 people have been arrested in connection with the 23-year-old's death, including two parliamentary assistants of a France Unbowed MP. This Wednesday,  It comes one month before municipal elections and as the left seeks to position itself ahead of next year's presidential vote. FRANCE 24's Carys Garland explains.

events.title: British couple sentenced to 10 years in prison in Iran, family say
events.summary:
British nationals Lindsay and Craig Foreman have been sentenced to 10 years
in prison over allegations of espionage in Iran.

events.title: US forces surrounding Iran show Trump's ready for a prolonged attack
events.summary: Donald Trump told protesters in Iran that "help was coming" a little over a month ago.

events.title: Former South Korean president handed life sentence
events.summary: A South Korean court has sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison after he imposed martial law in the country in 2024.

events.title: Mourinho has 'failed us' over racism row, says ex-Man Utd star
events.summary: Former Manchester United player Mikael Silvestre has claimed Jose Mourinho has "failed us" over his response to Vinicius Junior's allegations of racist abuse.

events.title: Ex-Victoria's Secret mogul says Epstein 'stole vast sums from our family'
events.summary: A billionaire mogul says paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein stole vast sums from his family.

events.title: Why Donald Trump is angry about the Chagos deal
events.summary: Donald Trump has once again criticised the UK's decision to hand the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, in a deal that includes a formal transfer of Diego Garcia, home to a key US military base.

events.title: Eight skiers found dead after avalanche in California amid 'horrific conditions'
events.summary: Eight skiers have been found dead, and one is still missing, after an avalanche in the northern California mountains, authorities have said.

events.title: Ex-South Korean president found guilty of insurrection over martial law order
events.summary: Yoon Suk Yeol, the impeached president of South Korea, was found guilty of insurrection and sentenced to life in prison on Thursday over his failed attempt to impose martial law on the U.S. ally

events.title: U.S. military pushes more weaponry into the Middle East for possible strikes on Iran
events.summary: WASHINGTON — The Defense Department is sending a large array of additional weaponry to the Middle East, including more warships, air defenses and submarines, in preparation for a possible military strike on Iran if President Donald Trump makes that decision, according to U.S. officials and information from public tracking.

events.summary: Precise, deniable and, in Russia’s case, grimly familiar.

events.title: An artist, a geophysicist and a fruit seller: Accounts of Iran's brutal crackdown emerge
events.summary: With Iran still reeling from a brutal crackdown on protests, details about victims are trickling out and the world is gradually getting a clearer picture of the violence used.

events.title: Venezuelans rally more openly as they navigate changing political landscape
events.summary: As people participate in more protests, they’re demanding the government release political prisoners as it has pledged to do.

events.title: 'A dream of mine my entire life": Mac Forehand on winning silver in the men's big air competition
events.summary: Newly-minted Team USA silver medalist Mac Forehand spoke with NBC News' Joe Fryer and Christine Romans about winning second in the men's big air competition. Forehand said, "It was a dream of mine my entire life." Watch the 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics on NBC and streaming on Peacock.

events.title: Iran’s foreign minister comments on nuclear talks with U.S
events.summary: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi was hopeful the Geneva talks would “lead to a sustainable and negotiated solution,” but also warned that “Iran remains fully prepared to defend itself against any threat.”

events.title: Elana Meyers Taylor on winning gold in monobob at the Winter Games
events.summary: Elana Meyers Taylor, the most decorated female bobsledder of all time, won gold in the women's monobob competition during her fifth Olympic appearance. NBC News' Vicky Nguyen and Morgan Radford interviewed Taylor about her win and how she juggles being an Olympian and mother.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: In the West Bank, new Israeli regulations stoke Palestinian fears of annexation
events.summary: In the Palestinian city of Hebron fears about new Israeli regulations on land registration and tightening control are stoking fears of annexation.

events.title: Republican congressman's anti-Muslim remark prompts calls for his resignation
events.summary: Rep. Randy Fine, R-Fla., prompted calls for his resignation from Democrats and a major Islamic civil rights group after suggesting in a social media post that he'd choose dogs over Muslims."If they force us to choose, the choice between dogs and Muslims is not a difficult one," Fine posted to the social media platform X on Sunday.

events.title: Epstein files revelations spark new European police probes
events.summary: The files related to Jeffrey Epstein released by the Department of Justice have led to new police investigations in Paris and London.

events.title: Ukraine officials to boycott Paralympics for letting Russians compete under their flag
events.summary: Ukraine said Wednesday that its officials will not attend the Winter Paralympics next month over organizers’ decision to allow a handful of Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete under their flags

events.title: 'Difficult' peace talks spotlight Putin's chief negotiator and Ukraine antagonist
events.summary: Russia and Ukraine don’t agree on much, but both sides left the latest round of U.S.-led peace talks Wednesday describing the negotiations as “difficult.”Moscow — and increasingly President Donald Trump — have blamed Ukraine for the absence of a deal, while Kyiv argues it is instead the Kremlin that is stalling

events.title: U.S. and Iran tout progress in nuclear talks as supreme leader warns Trump over military buildup
events.summary: The United States and Iran have reached an understanding on the “guiding principles” in nuclear talks, Tehran’s foreign minister said Tuesday, though he cautioned that work still needs to be done to reach an agreement and head off the threat of an American military attack.“I believe we made good progress,” said Abbas Araghchi, the head of the Iranian delegation in Geneva.

events.title: British airline bans two 'disruptive' passengers for life after midair brawl
events.summary: British airline Jet2 announced that it banned two travelers for life after they started brawling on a flight bound for Manchester, England, on Thursday, resulting in its diversion

events.title: Doctors Without Borders suspends some work at Gaza’s Nasser Hospital due to presence of armed men
events.summary: Doctors Without Borders has announced the suspension of some operations at one of Gaza ‘s largest functioning hospitals after patients and staff reported seeing armed, masked men roaming parts of the building

events.title: Marco Rubio has warmer words for Europe weeks after Trump's harsh Davos comments
events.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke at the Munich Security Conference on Saturday in an apparent effort to paper over cracks in the relationship between the U.S. and Europe, though foreign diplomats were less convinced that real change would follow

events.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine, not Russia, is facing pressure to make concessions to end war
events.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused the U.S. of focusing on Ukrainian concessions to bring an end to the war, rather than pressing Russia

events.title: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned by deadly 'dart frog' toxin, Europeans say
events.summary: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny died in prison after being poisoned with a deadly toxin found in Ecuadorian dart frogs, the U.K. and other allies claimed Saturday

events.title: Future kings meet in Saudi Arabia but Epstein revelations loom over Prince William
events.summary: Prince Williams trip to Saudi Arabia to meet with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman came at a crucial time for the U.K. but the former Prince Andrew loomed.

events.title: CIA makes new push to recruit spies from Chinese military
events.summary: The CIA released a new Mandarin-language video on Thursday appealing to members of China’s military to spy for the United States and work toward “a brighter future,” weeks after Beijing ousted a top general as part of a purge of top brass.
